item.title: Sounds - why doesn't this work?
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

They should work, I just tried the latter.
Make sure an old version of your applet isn’t prefetched by clearing your Java cache. (control panel -> Java -> temporary internet files & settings -> delete files)

Read full topic

item.title: Sounds - why doesn't this work?
item.dc:creator: @supamagier supamagier
item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

Hey, I wanna add sounds to an applet, but it won’t work. I used this:

[code]import java.applet.;
import javax.swing.;
import java.io.;
import java.net.;
import java.awt.*;
public class Applet1 extends JApplet
{
AudioClip song;
public void init()
{
try {
song = Applet.newAudioClip(new URL(getCodeBase(),“song.mid”));
}
catch(Exception e){ e.printStackTrace(); }

song.play();
}

}[/code]

and this:

[code]import java.awt.;
import java.applet.;

public class Applet1 extends Applet
{
AudioClip sound;
public void init()
{
sound = getAudioClip(getDocumentBase(),“song.mid”);
sound.play();
}
}[/code]

Both don’t work - The directory is fine, in the same map as the code, de song works fine when I play it with wmp, I know java does accept .mid, so what’s wrong? Couldn’t find anything about it on google.

Read full topic
